displaySolutionDescription: Task is updated to contain the solution.
a11yClickableTextLabel: Full text where words can be marked
a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
textField:
Sal the Cow

There once was a *소* named *살*
She had too much *우동*
And not enough *운동*,
A thought that made her sad.

She wanted to be happy
And not always *창피*.
So she trained to be a
*선수* of jujitsu,
But still *살* the *소* was sad.

She went to a library
And checked out a *책*.
She studied old *한문*
And even the new moon,
But still *살* the *소* was sad.

Though many in *나이* she began to cry
When of a sudden the *농사* walked by.

He asked “*무슨* *일이야*?”
To which she said “Yeah”
And wrote him a poem
To tell him her *마음*.
taskDescription:
Machine translation may be a shortcut to languages you do not know (yet). Try it out for unknown languages!

1) Mark the Korean words in this poem by Tim Scroggins (https://allpoetry.com/Tim_Scroggins). You will need to highlight the words with your cursor in order to be able to copy/paste them into a machine translator.

2) Copy and paste the Korean words in a machine translator to understand the meaning.
